I beg to state that my father Sheikh Abdullah bin Ahmad al Rawaf Najdi, a Qadi resident of Bu Ali, has been killed by the Beni Hasan intentionally without any reason. He was attacked in the later part of the night of 24th Bfuharram in his house and was killed by shooting. He was neither fighting nor was there any cause for a fight, but he was killed in a battle field. He was not carrying any weapons. They knew of his position and place of residence. He was a foreigner to them. As the deceased is my father and I am a subject of Saudi Arabian Government, who are responsible to look after us, and your station is nearest to the place of murder, I request to you to apply the provisions of the laws existing between our two Governments in a case of this kind. I request that you will kindly give me the possible reasons that lead to the murder of my father as religious and other laws demand it. I further request that you will kindly let me know if the laws existing between our Governments are the same that exist between our Government and other Governments of the world. mods.abstract: This file relates to two separate subjects. The first is the reported murder of Abdullah bin Ahmad al-Rawaf, a Saudi Arabian subject, by Beni Hasan tribesmen. The second is a trip to Sur, which was recently undertaken by the Political Agent and Consul at Muscat, Major Tom Hickinbotham. The correspondence includes a brief report by the Political Agent of his visit to Sur, as well as his description of a lake near the village of Ghail Shaab, which he highlights as a potential source of fresh water for visiting sea vessels.The Arabic language material consists of letters addressed to the Wali of Sur by Ali bin Abdullah al Hamood [Shaikh Ali bin Abdullah Al Hamudah, Emir of Ja'alan] and Suleiman bin Abdullah al-Rawaf, son of Abdullah bin Ahmad al-Rawaf.
